meanings.definition: In a way that relates to norms or standards.
meanings.sent1: She normatively followed the rules of the game.
meanings.sent2: The company normatively adhered to industry standards.
meanings.sent3: The cat normatively decided to nap in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: His painting was normatively colorful, standing out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept normatively, making it easy to understand.

meanings.definition: In a way that prescribes norms or standards.
meanings.sent1: The committee normatively set guidelines for the project.
meanings.sent2: The law normatively dictates how businesses should operate.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel normatively stored nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was normatively strong, guiding the team effectively.
meanings.sent5: The recipe was normatively clear, ensuring perfect results every time.
